definition: a fashion show/to walk the runway (in a fashion show)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: Q: What was your first catwalk show like?
sentences.chinese: 你的第一次走秀怎么样？

sentences.english: Claudia Schiffer appears in her first runway show, modelling Chanel.
sentences.chinese: 克劳迪娅希弗在香奈儿的T台上完成了第一次走秀。

sentences.english: But the news said that there are eight model girls in the swimming suits having shows in SHAOLIN TEMPLE.
sentences.chinese: 但是新闻上说八个模特穿着泳装在少林走秀啊。

sentences.english: You watch those late-night girls in bikini shows.
sentences.chinese: 你在午夜收看比基尼女郎走秀。

sentences.english: There were several show-stopping finales at Milan fashion week this season.
sentences.chinese: 本季的米兰时装周有几场走秀。

definition: to be a spokesperson/to be an ambassador (for a brand)/to endorse
